member.summary: Composes a short, easily parsable string that contains the assembly's name and version. The format is the same used for User-Agent headers, namely "{Name}/{Version}".

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.AppTelemetryUtility.ParseBooleanEnvironmentVariable(System.String)
member.summary: Parses an environment variable value that accepts "1", "0", "true", "false" (case insensitive) and returns its boolean value. When the value is not set, or is invalid, null is returned.
member.param: The environment value. i.e.
member.returns: true when the value is "1" or "true"; false when the value is "0" or "false"; otherwise, null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.CheckedOperationHolder`1
member.summary: An implementation that will verify operations get disposed in the correct order, avoiding hard to identify lost telemetry bugs.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.AppInsightsResource
member.summary: Represents the connection information to an Application Insights resource.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.AppInsightsResource.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new resource represented by the specified connection string.
member.param: The connection string for the App Insights resource as copied from the Azure Portal.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.AppInsightsResource.InstrumentationKey
member.summary: Gets the instrumentation key for this resource. This value is set by specifying the ;

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.AppInsightsResource.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets the connection string to use for this resource. The value should be set to the copy/paste from the Azure Portal's value for Connection String. Setting this will also set the property for backwards compatibility.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.AppInsightsResource.DataBoundary
member.summary: The data boundary (aka Azure Region) this resource belongs to. May be null.
member.remarks:
The values for this property can be found via the MSGraph `/organization` entity's `dataBoundary` privileged property.
At the time of writing, the only supported value is "EU", but others may be applicable in the future.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.AppOperationCorrelationTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Initializes telemetry with the value of a telemetry source (aka SyntheticSource).
Creates a new instance using the passed in instance and initializers for the minimum required setup for a client app.
member.param: An optional mapping from the to a SyntheticSource.
member.remarks: Callers should perform their own logic on the returned configuration for functionality like: - Flushing and disposing of the TelemetryConfiguration, as it is IDisposable and controls when the channel batched data will get flushed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.AppTelemetryConfigUtility.GetUserSettingsFromSharedInstall
member.summary: Most tools don't expose the ability to modify the users configuration settings, so this helper simplifies calling code by just getting it from the default location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.AppTelemetryConfigUtility.ComposeTelemetryCacheFolderPathForProduct(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Composes the folder path to the shared telemetry cache folder for the passed in product assembly.
member.param: The assembly representing this product. It's name is used as a sub-folder path.
The default uses .
member.returns: The full path to the cache folder.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.AppTelemetryConfigUtility.ComposeTelemetryCacheFolderPathForProduct(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Composes the folder path to the shared telemetry cache folder for the passed in product assembly.
member.param: The product name to use when creating the sub-folder for the cache.
The default uses .
member.returns: The full path to the cache folder.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.AppTelemetryEnvironment.OptOut
member.summary: Indicates that this process should opt out of telemetry.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.ClientAppTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Initializes common telemetry context for a client app by setting global context values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.ClientAppTelemetryInitializer.#ctor(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Guid,System.Guid,System.String)
member.param: The 'cloud_RoleName' value in Application Insights.
The assembly describing the product or execution program that created the session.
Unique id for the current process. If not explicitly specified, will create a new one.
By default, the roleInstance is redacted so we don't capture the user's machine name. Set this explicitly to null if you'd like to use the current machine name

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.IAppTelemetryEnvironment
member.summary: The settings parsed from the current environment. When derived from environment variables these values should use the global env variable names specified in . Each application may choose to also implement their own environment variables or other source for getting these settings. e.g. the Pac CLI may choose to have its own env vars with a different prefix like "PAC_CLI_*". In this case, it's recommended to still use the global env variable names ("PP_TOOLS_*") for when the app-specific variables are not set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.IAppTelemetryEnvironment.OptOut
member.summary: Indicates that this process should opt out of telemetry.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.IAppTelemetryEnvironment.DataBoundary
member.summary: The data boundary region for which all telemetry should be sent.
member.remarks: The values supported here piggy-back on the AAD Organization's `dataBoundary` property. If an application doesn't support this data boundary, then the default for the application will be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.IAppTelemetryEnvironment.AutomationAgent
member.summary: The 'User-Agent' string representing the automation agent calling the current program. The syntax of this value should be in the same format expected for HTTP User-Agent header.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.IAppTelemetryEnvironment.LegacyTelemetrySource
member.summary: The 'TelemetrySource' as specified by the legacy env variable .

member.summary: The unique id for the user logged in to the machine.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.ITelemetryUserSettings.TelemetryEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether the user default for whether to enable telemetry.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.ITelemetryUserSettingsProvider.GetCurrent
member.summary: Gets a snapshot of the current user settings.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.ITelemetryUserSettingsProvider.SetConfigValueTelemetryEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the configurable 'TelemetryEnabled' setting and persists to storage.
member.param: Indicates explicit setting for whether telemetry should be enabled for this user. Setting to `null` resets to the default per app.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.MultiProcessIO
member.summary: This class contains utilities that can help simplify robust file management activities when multiple processes may be accessing the same file.
member.remarks: This is intentially an internal class so as to prevent unexpected breaking changes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.SyntheticSourceTelemetryInitializer

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.TelemetryUserSettings
member.summary: Immutable user settings for telemetry.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.TelemetryUserSettingsFileProvider
member.summary: An implementation of that uses a file on disk as the persistent storage.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.TelemetryUserSettingsProviderExtensions.GetCurrentOrDefault(Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.ITelemetryUserSettingsProvider)
member.summary: Gets the current user settings if available and able. Otherwise, returns a new settings instance with a new one-time uniqueId. This method will never throw.
member.returns: The current valid user settings, or a temporary default instance.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Extensibility.UserSettingsException
member.summary: An exception occurred interacting with the user settings file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.IAppTelemetryClient
member.summary: A client for creating telemetry around an underlying App Insights instance.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.OneDS.TransportAsJsonStringConverter
member.summary: Converter that supports serializing any object as a JSON string. OneDS collector seems to fail ingestion silently when a data property is not a value type (string, number, boolean). So complex properties on a 'Data' object should be serialized as a JSON string. When the target data table supports a kusto 'dynamic' type, it'll get the parsed JSON object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.OperationTelemetryResultCode
member.summary: Common result codes for telemetry operations which are supported by the shared telemetry platform. These are based upon the enum, but are limited to codes that apply to a CLI app.
member.remarks: Care should be taken about translating http service result codes from services called from a CLI and whether the code should be passed thru or translated to a different code based on the application logic.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.OperationTelemetryResultCode.BadRequest
member.summary: Indicates a bad command line was recieved (e.g. input error, invalid args, etc)

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.OperationTelemetryResultCode.NotFound
member.summary: Indicates an unknown command or action by the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.OperationTelemetryResultCode.InternalApplicationError
member.summary: General internal application error, unknown, unhandled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.OperationTelemetryResultCode.BadGateway
member.summary: Indicates an error originating from code external to the application, usually coming from a service call.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.OperationTelemetryResultCodeExtensions.ApplyResultCode(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.DataContracts.RequestTelemetry,Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.OperationTelemetryResultCode)
member.summary: Updates the and properties according to the specified .

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.OperationTelemetryResultCodeExtensions.ApplyResultCode(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.DataContracts.DependencyTelemetry,Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.OperationTelemetryResultCode)
member.summary: Updates the and properties according to the specified .

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.StartStopEventsTracker
member.summary: A helper class that tracks custom start/stop events with support for capturing the duration, success and optionally a result code.
member.remarks: This class is especially helpful for tracking operations which may overlap in an asynchronous manner (which App Insights operations do not support).

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.StartStopEventsTracker.#ctor(Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.IAppTelemetryClient,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance and immediately tracks the 'start' event.
member.param: The telemetry client
The name of the 'start' event.
The name of the 'stop' event.
Custom properties passed to the 'start' event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.StartStopEventsTracker.Success
member.summary: Indicates whether the operation represented by this instance was succesful. If is set, the default for this property is set to ; otherwise, `false`. If your app's logic doesn't match with the semantics of , simply set this value explicitly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.StartStopEventsTracker.ResultCode
member.summary: Optional value indicating a result code for the operation. This setting is only included if specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.StartStopEventsTracker.ElapsedMilliseconds
member.summary: Gets the total elapsed time since the start of the current instance, in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.StartStopEventsTracker.StopProperties
member.summary: The dictionary of properties that will be used to submit the results for the 'stop' event when this instance is disposed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.StartStopEventsTracker.StopMetrics
member.summary: The dictionary of properties that will be used to submit the results for the 'stop' event when this instance is disposed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.StartStopEventsTracker.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tracks the 'stop' event, and incorporates the values of , , .

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.BatchedTelemetryChannel.UploaderFolderPath
member.summary: The folder path in which to find the uploader program. The default in a sub folder named 'bt-uploader' relative to where this assembly is located. Note: It is best to set this to a fully qualified path to remove ambiguity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.BatchedTransmitter`1.UploaderFolderPath
member.summary: The folder path in which to find the uploader program. The default in a sub folder named 'bt-uploader' relative to where this assembly is located. Note: It is best to set this to a fully qualified path to remove ambiguity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.BatchedTransmitter`1.UploaderMaxIdleTimeSeconds
member.summary: Set the number of seconds of idle time before the spawned uploader (called during a Flush/Dispose) will exit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.BatchedTransmitter`1.MaxWaitMillisecondsOnDisposeToDetectUploaderFailure
member.summary: The maximum number of milliseconds to wait to see if the uploader process has exited with a failure. If the uploader process has failed, an exception will be thrown in this process. This is done as part of the call to the Dispose method. It's suggested to set this on DEBUG builds to help identify these kind of errors during development time. Most likely, this value need not be more than a couple seconds, as errors on process startup tend to happen quickly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.BatchedTransmitter`1.SkipStartUploadProcess
member.summary: [For unit tests only] Setting this to true will prevent starting the upload process.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.BatchedTransmitter`1.LastUploadProcessStarted
member.summary: [For unit tests only]

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.BatchedTransmitter`1.EnableCaptureProcessOutput
member.summary: [For unit tests only] When set to true, the output from the upload process will be capturable and available from after the process has exited.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.BatchedTransmitter`1.LastUploadProcessOutput
member.summary: [For unit tests only] Returns all the text from the upload process output. Note: each line is prepended with `ERR` or `OUT` to indicate which stream it came from.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.TelemetryBuffer`1.Count
member.summary: The number of items currently contained in the buffer. These have not been flushed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.TelemetryBuffer`1.BacklogSize
member.summary: The maximum number of items that can be stored in the backlog to be sent. New items will get dropped once this limit is reached.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.TelemetryChannelBase`1.#ctor(Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.TelemetryBuffer{`0},Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.ITelemetryTransmitter)
member.param: The transmitter implementation, which will be disposed when this instance is disposed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.TelemetryChannelBase`1.DisableFlushOnDispose
member.summary: Indicates whether will call before disposing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.TelemetryChannelBase`1.ValidateItem(`0)
member.summary:
When overridden in a derived class, allows the channel to perform validation on the item before sending to the internal buffer.
Note for implementers:
Consider logging invalid items to instead of throwing when in production.
member.param: The telemetry item about to be sent to buffer.
member.returns: True if the item is valid and should be sent to the buffer, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.TelemetryTransmitterBase`1.Flush
member.summary: Called when there's an explicit request to flush the buffer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.TelemetryTransmitterBase`1.OnBufferFull
member.summary: Default implementation calls .

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryChannel.TelemetryTransmitterBase`1.OnDisposing
member.summary: Called when the transmitter is being disposed. This will only be called once.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryConstants.PropertyNames
member.summary: Common property names used for telemetry captured for shared tools. Note: The naming convention for properties (and metrics) is to use cammelCaseNames.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryConstants.PropertyNames.trackedAtMemberName
member.summary: The property name used for events to allow us to track where an exception event was being recorded. Because it's possible to track an exception at multiple spots in the call stack, this can help to identify where in the call stack the exception is being tracked. This is esp helpful for helper functions that help capture the context but doesn't actually handle the exception, e.g. and its overloads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryConstants.PropertyNames.LegacyTelemetrySource
member.summary: The legacy name of the custom property used for indicating the telemetry source. New code should set the . Note: the legacy property name used TitleCase, so this one does too.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryConstants.MetricNames
member.summary: Common metric names used to telemetry captured for shared tools. Note: The naming convention for metrics is different than properties to align with common App Insights metrics.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryConstants.MetricNames.DurationMs
member.summary: Indicates the duration of some operation. Usually included as part of the 'end'/'stop' event that has a matching 'begin'/'start' event. This metric should have the same semantic as the duration captured by an AI operation (i.e. Request or Dependency). Most importantly, that the value should be in milliseconds.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryConstants.MetricNames.LegacyExecutionTimeMs
member.summary: Legacy name used to report the execution time of some arbitrary operation. New code should use instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryConstants.EnvironmentVariableNames.LegacyTelemetrySource
member.summary: This is the legacy env variable used by old ProcessLauncher implementations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryConstants.EnvironmentVariableNames.PpToolsTelemetryOptOut
member.summary: To opt out of telemetry, set this environment variable to `1` or `true`.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryConstants.EnvironmentVariableNames.PpToolsTelemetryDataBoundary
member.summary: To specify a data boundary region for which all telemetry should be sent.
member.remarks: The values supported here piggy-back on the AAD Organization's `dataBoundary` property. If an application doesn't support this data boundary, then the default for the application will be used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TelemetryConstants.EnvironmentVariableNames.PpToolsAutomationAgent
member.summary: Common environment variable that identifies when a tool is being called by some parent tool or custom script. The syntax of this value should be in the same format expected for HTTP User-Agent header.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Testing.NoopOperationHolder`1
member.summary: A no-op implementation of . It still provides callers the ability to access the property (set to a new instance) without getting a runtime exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Testing.NoopTelemetryChannel
member.summary: A no-op implementation of

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Testing.NoopTelemetryClient
member.summary: A no-op implementation of

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Testing.TelemetryChannelSpy
member.summary: An implementation of an that is sink, in that events are stored here, but never sent along. This type can be especially useful for cases where only runtime inspection is necessary; e.g. from unit tests. It simplifies the setup code needed in order to intercept actual telemetry data sent.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Testing.TelemetryChannelSpyBase`1
member.summary: A base implementation for many of the telemetry channels.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Testing.TelemetryChannelSpyBase`1.Flush
member.summary: Performs a seudo flush operation, allowing the to be updated, and later verified. It will not change the underlying capture of the .

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Testing.TelemetryChannelSpyBase`1.Clear
member.summary: Clears all items sent by this instance and resets to 0. Useful for scenarios where a test would like to ignore all previous events, and only capture new events. Note: does not change state of whether this instance has been disposed already; use a new instance in that case.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Testing.TelemetryChannelSpyBase`1.ValidateItem(`0)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, allows the channel to perform validation on the item before sending to the internal buffer. Default implementation always returns true.
member.param: The telemetry item about to be sent to buffer.
member.returns: True if the item is valid and should be sent to the buffer, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.Testing.TelemetryTestingUtility.CreateClientWithMinimalConfig(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.ITelemetryChannel)
member.summary: Creates a new using minimal configs and the channel specified. The default channel uses .
member.param: The channel to use for the . If this is not specified, a is used in order to swallow events.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.BatchedTelemetry.TraceContextHelper
member.summary: Helper for working with the W3C trace-context spec.

member.summary: Used for testing purposes.

member.summary: Non-blocking send of telemetry item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.BatchedOneDSTelemetryChannel.MaxWaitMillisecondsOnDisposeToDetectUploaderFailure
member.summary: The maximum number of milliseconds to wait to see if the uploader process has exited with a failure. If the uploader process has failed, an exception will be thrown in this process. This is done as part of the call to the Dispose method. It's suggested to set this on DEBUG builds to help identify these kind of errors during development time. Most likely, this value need not be more than a couple seconds, as errors on process startup tend to happen quickly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.BatchedOneDSTelemetryChannel.UploaderMaxIdleTimeSeconds
member.summary: Set the number of seconds of idle time before the spawned uploader (called during a Flush/Dispose) will exit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.BatchedOneDSTelemetryChannel.UploaderFolderPath
member.summary: The folder path in which to find the uploader program. The default in a sub folder named 'bt-uploader' relative to where this assembly is located. Note: It is best to set this to a fully qualified path to remove ambiguity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.BatchedOneDSTelemetryChannel.SkipStartUploadProcess
member.summary: [For unit tests only] Setting this to true will prevent starting the upload process.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.BatchedOneDSTelemetryChannel.LastUploadProcessStarted
member.summary: [For unit tests only]

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.BatchedOneDSTelemetryChannel.LastUploadProcessOutput
member.summary: [For unit tests only] Returns all the text from the upload process output. Note: each line is prepended with `ERR` or `OUT` to indicate which stream it came from.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.CommonSchemaV4Serializer

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.NoThrowTelemetryChannel
member.summary: A OneDS telemetry channel that catches any exceptions in the channel chain and logs the errors. This allows apps to choose to compose their own telemetry channel chain without having to worry about exceptions. For example, an app may choose to use this channel as the top-level channel in the chain, but only for non-DEBUG builds.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.SelfRoutingTelemetryChannel
member.summary: A OneDS telemetry channel that routes telemetry to different channels based on a property supplied by each supported telemetry item.
member.remarks: This class makes it possible for us to separate telemetry routing from being a top-level configuration concern.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.SelfRoutingTelemetryChannel.EnsureAllChannelsCreated
member.summary: Forces all inner channels to be created. By default, this class only creates channels when they are needed. This method allows testing and clients to force all channels to be created for their own purposes. e.g. in Debug mode, to ensure tesing with all channels active.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.Testing.OneDSTelemetryChannelSpy
member.summary: An implementation of an that is sink, in that events are stored here, but never sent along. This type can be especially useful for cases where only runtime inspection is necessary; e.g. from unit tests. It simplifies the setup code needed in order to intercept actual telemetry data sent.

member.summary: The instrumentation key used for .

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags
member.summary: https://www.osgwiki.com/wiki/CommonSchema/flags

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags.EventPersistence_Mask
member.summary: Mask for the first byte

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags.EventPersistence_Normal
member.summary: an event can be lost due to low bandwidth or disk space constraints

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags.EventPersistence_Critical
member.summary: Used for events that should be prioritized over non-critical events. (It is unrelated to retention in Cosmos.)

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags.EventLatency_Mask
member.summary: Mask for the second byte

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags.EventLatency_Normal
member.summary: Default latency

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags.EventLatency_RealTime
member.summary: Low latency event. The platform may restrict events that can use this flag

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags.EventLatency_CostDeferred
member.summary: Latency depends on network cost. Functionally treated as "Normal" latency for N days, then becomes "RealTime" latency. The platform may restrict events that can use this flag

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags.EventScrub_Mask
member.summary: Mask for the third byte

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags.Microsoft_Test
member.summary: Reflects the value of the SQM IsTest registry key

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags.Microsoft_Internal
member.summary: Reflects the value of the SQM MSFTInternal registry key

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags.Microsoft_IsPII_Mark
member.summary: https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/osg_core_fun/idt/OSGInstrument/SitePages/De-Identification%20of%20Telemetry%20Events.aspx Contains PII. If an event is logged with LogOption.Sensitive using Service Logging Library(SLL), then the flags field will have the IsPII bit turned ON and the event will be considered UserSensitive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags.Microsoft_IsPII_Hash
member.summary: Client has hashed or dropped any PII information in the event. Vortex will hash any server-supplied PII fields such as PUID or Global Device ID

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags.Microsoft_IsPII_Drop
member.summary: Client has dropped any PII information in the event. Information contained within attached MSA token will not be inserted

member.name: F:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.OneDS.UtcFlags.Microsoft_IsPII_Scrub
member.summary: See details here.Collector to scrub ext.ingest.clientIp field stamped server-side.This takes precedence over both Hash Identifier and Drop Identifier flags above, so as long as this bit is set, the client IP will be scrubbed as "xxx.xxx.xxx.*" for IPv4 and will not be dropped. The main use case for this flag is Interchange customers that need to use OriginalMessage feature but wish not to have IP info in Geneva data store. For more details on this scenario: 1DS Interchange Default CommonSchema

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.ShellTelemetry.PpuxEventTelemetryData
member.summary:
Part C These fields are defined by the Event Author, who has complete control over naming and data type of the fields. The Event Author is responsible for populating these fields when an event is instantiated. https://github.com/microsoft/common-schema/blob/main/README.md
Event An actual instantiation of a set of data described by an Event Definition.This is the data that actually gets logged and transmitted over the wire to the Asimov system. An event emitted in response to a significant action or interaction. The data payload of the event describes attributes and semantics about the stimulus that triggered its creation.
https://eng.ms/docs/cloud-ai-platform/business-applications-and-platform/bap-power-apps/power-platform-ux/telemetry/powerplatformux/event

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.TfmAdapters.DebugAnnotated
member.summary: When targeting netstandard2.0 and netframework TFMs, many framework APIs do not have the nullable annotations. This causes the compiler to emit warnings for all of these APIs. Callers must then add extra checks in cross-TFM code just to appease the compiler because it thinks a value may be null. This class is a simple wrapper around some of these utilities and adds the nullable annotations.
member.remarks: Each of these methods is a simple wrapper around the corresponding string method. To optimize compiled code, we also hint to the compiler to aggressively inline these methods so to remove any overhead of the wrapper.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.TfmAdapters.StringAnnotated
member.summary: When targeting netstandard2.0 and netframework TFMs, many framework APIs do not have the nullable annotations. This causes the compiler to emit warnings for all of these APIs. Callers must then add extra checks in cross-TFM code just to appease the compiler because it thinks a value may be null. This class is a simple wrapper around some of these utilities and adds the nullable annotations.
member.remarks: Each of these methods is a simple wrapper around the corresponding string method. To optimize compiled code, we also hint to the compiler to aggressively inline these methods so to remove any overhead of the wrapper.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.TfmAdapters.TfmAdaptersStringExtensions.ReplaceOrdinal(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a new string in which all occurrences of a specified string in the current instance are replaced with another specified string, using ordinal comparison.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerPlatform.Tooling.TfmAdapters.TfmAdaptersStringExtensions.ContainsOrdinal(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether a specified string occurs within this string, using ordinal comparison.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute class.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method will not return if the associated Boolean parameter is passed the specified value.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified parameter value.
member.param: The condition parameter value. Code after the method will be considered unreachable by diagnostics if the argument to the associated parameter matches this value.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.ParameterValue
member.summary: Gets the condition parameter value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method or property will ensure that the listed field and property members have not-null values.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with a field or property member.
member.param: The field or property member that is promised to be not-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the list of field and property members.
member.param: The list of field and property members that are promised to be not-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.Members
member.summary: Gets field or property member names.

member.name: T:System.TfmMissingApisString
member.summary: This class adds members to the String class which are not available in any of the .net frameworks, but are in Core.
